creator: heinrich.mislik@univie.ac.at
text:
When an external rewriting program (MapType: prg) returns a line longer then 
LONG_STRING_LEN (2048), mod_rewrite fails to read the whole line. The rest of the
line will be read with the next request. Symptoms are the same as for bug 14453.

As a workaround the external rewriting program should not return such lines.

As a bugfix mod_rewrite should read and discard the rest of the line and return
NULL.

Created attachment 17295
Stop long URLs returned by external rewrite process causing mod_rewrite to get out of sync

Basically always read up to \n in input stream, but only fill buffer up to
LONG_STRING_LEN-1 chars
creator: apache@robm.fastmail.fm

text:
Have also hit this bug. It's rather annoying because it causes apache and the
rewrite process to get out of sync. Because of the way our system works, this
isn't immediately easily detectable and ends up causing intermittent and random
problems. Attached patch should fix it.
creator: apache@robm.fastmail.fm
